--- Kenneth Stanley <kstanley@...> wrote:
> There is probably a more serious problem than the
> fitness function,
> since this is quite abnormal.  By the way, if you
> download either 
> Mattias Fagerlund's demos or Ugo Vierruci's JNEAT,
> you can watch XOR 
> in action and see how solutions should look.

Thanks, Ken.  We're having a look at Ugo's
implementation now for comparison.

JNEAT does find very efficient solutions in a
relatively small number of generations...seems to be
working quite well.

However, I've noticed some strange topologies
displaying via the gui.  I don't know if this is a
problem with the gui or with the algorithm itself.

I've uploaded pics of these in the Photos section of
our Yahoo Group.

For example, here the First Winner Genome as a node
(9), which appears to have to incoming connections,
but no outgoing connections.  How would such a
structure even be allowed to evolve with NEAT?

http://photos.groups.yahoo.com/group/neat/vwp?.dir=/&.src=gr&.dnm=example1.gif&.view=t&.done=http%3a//photos.groups.yahoo.com/group/neat/lst%3f%26.dir=/%26.src=gr%26.view=t

Here's another, where the Current Genome has a node
(12) without any outgoing connections:

http://photos.groups.yahoo.com/group/neat/vwp?.dir=/&.src=gr&.dnm=example2.gif&.view=t&.done=http%3a//photos.groups.yahoo.com/group/neat/lst%3f%26.dir=/%26.src=gr%26.view=t

And another:

http://photos.groups.yahoo.com/group/neat/vwp?.dir=/&.src=gr&.dnm=example3.gif&.view=t&.done=http%3a//photos.groups.yahoo.com/group/neat/lst%3f%26.dir=/%26.src=gr%26.view=t

Is this an error, or am I not understanding how either
NEAT or JNEAT works?

> How many generations are your runs going?  How many
> species are you 
> seeing form?  What does your fitness graph look
> like?  When does it 
> typically lift off the plateau (where it still
> hasn't made the 
> crucial connection that allows the problem to be
> solved)?

Don't know yet.  We've only been looking at textual
output so far.  But within the next day or two we'll
generate some graphics and upload them to the Photos
section.

Thanks,
Derek
